hook.text: A surgeon says 90% survive. You relax. She says 10% die. You panic. Exact same fact.

buildup.text: Framing is how the same information presented differently changes your decision.

discovery.text: Stores use it constantly. 'Save $20' and '20% off' feel different but can be identical.

twist.text: Financial products frame to hide costs. '$9.99/month' obscures the $120 yearly total.

climax.text: Reframing helps you. Ask 'How many hours of work is this?' instead of 'Can I afford it?'

punchline.text: Change the frame, change the decision.

quiz.question: What is 'framing' in finance?
options: Presenting the same info differently to influence choices
